    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next byte of data from the input. The value byte is returned as an int in the range 0 to 255. If no byte is available because the end of the stream has been reached, an EOFException is thrown. This method blocks until input data is available, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs.
        Returns:
        the next byte of data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected or any I/O error occurs.

      • read

        public void read(byte[] b,
        int off,
        int len)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads len bytes of data from the input into the array b. If len is zero, then no bytes are read. This method blocks until all bytes could be read, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs. If the stream ends before len bytes could be read an EOFException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is read.
        off - the start offset in array b at which the data is written.
        len - the number of bytes to read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • readBytes

        public long readBytes(int n)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads up to eight bytes as a long value. This method blocks until all bytes could be read, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of bytes to read >0 and <=8
        Returns:
        the read bytes as a long value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if n is not in the range [1...8] inclusive.

      • readBytes

        public void readBytes(byte[] b)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads data from the input stream and stores them into the buffer array b. This method blocks until all bytes could be read, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs. If the length of b is zero, then no bytes are read.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(int n)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads n bytes from the input as a String. The bytes are directly converted into characters. If not enough bytes could be read, an EOFException is thrown. This method blocks until all bytes could be read, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs.
        Parameters:
        n - the length of the String.
        Returns:
        the String, that was read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • readUTFString

        public java.lang.String readUTFString(int max,
                             java.lang.String encoding)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a null-terminated UTF-encoded String from the input. The maximum number of bytes that can be read before the null must appear must be specified. Although the method is preferred for unicode, the encoding can be any charset name, that is supported by the system. This method blocks until all bytes could be read, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum number of bytes to read, before the null-terminator must appear.
        encoding - the charset used to encode the String
        Returns:
        the decoded String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • readUTFString

        public java.lang.String readUTFString(int max)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a null-terminated UTF-encoded String from the input. The maximum number of bytes that can be read before the null must appear must be specified. The encoding is detected automatically, it may be UTF-8 or UTF-16 (determined by a byte order mask at the beginning). This method blocks until all bytes could be read, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum number of bytes to read, before the null-terminator must appear.
        Returns:
        the decoded String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • readTerminated

        public byte[] readTerminated(int max,
                    int terminator)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a byte array from the input that is terminated by a specific byte (the 'terminator'). The maximum number of bytes that can be read before the terminator must appear must be specified. The terminator will not be included in the returned array. This method blocks until all bytes could be read, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum number of bytes to read, before the terminator must appear.
        terminator - the byte that indicates the end of the array
        Returns:
        the buffer into which the data is read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • readFixedPoint

        public double readFixedPoint(int m,
                    int n)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a fixed point number from the input. The number is read as a m.n value, that results from deviding an integer by 2n.
        Parameters:
        m - the number of bits before the point
        n - the number of bits after the point
        Returns:
        a floating point number with the same value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the total number of bits (m+n) is not a multiple of eight

      • skipBytes

        public void skipBytes(long n)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Skips n bytes in the input. This method blocks until all bytes could be skipped, the end of the stream is detected, or an I/O error occurs.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of bytes to skip
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the end of the stream is detected, the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • getOffset

        public long getOffset()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the current offset in the stream.
        Returns:
        the current offset
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs (only when using a RandomAccessFile)

      • seek

        public void seek(long pos)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Seeks to a specific offset in the stream. This is only possible when using a RandomAccessFile. If an InputStream is used, this method throws an IOException.
        Parameters:
        pos - the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an InputStream is used, pos is less than 0 or an I/O error occurs

      • hasRandomAccess

        public boolean hasRandomAccess()
        Indicates, if random access is available. That is, if this MP4InputStream was constructed with a RandomAccessFile. If this method returns false, seeking is not possible.
        Returns:
        true if random access is available

      • hasLeft

        public boolean hasLeft()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Indicates, if the input has some data left.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one byte left
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
